str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From afar, far off, from a distance. From porrho with adverbial enclitic of source; from far, or at a distance, i.e. Distantly.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
And, even, also, namely.
From para and the base of epidemeo; an alien alongside, i.e. A resident foreigner.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
